newsitem.title: USA: FileNet sees Q1 loss due to weak orders.
newsitem.headline: FileNet sees Q1 loss due to weak orders.

text.p: FileNet Corp said it expects to report a first quarter net loss of about $9.0 million or $0.60 per share on revenues of $47 million due to weak orders in domestic and international markets.
In the first quarter last year, FileNet posted a net loss of $11.8 million or $0.79 a share, including a one-time, after-tax charge of $16 million, on revenues of $66.7 million.
FileNet dropped 4-3/4 to 11-1/8 and was one of the most active Nasdaq issues in late morning trade.

"New orders were unexpectedly weak for the quarter," said FileNet Chief Executive Ted Smith. "The weakness was experienced in both our domestic and international markets. In particular, several large orders solicited by our European and North American sales organizations did not come through."

FileNet, which makes integrated image, data processing systems using optical disk technology, also said it expects to take a second quarter charge of between $2.5 million and $3.0 million to consolidate its imaging product development groups.
The imaging product activities will be relocated to Costa Mesa, Calif. from its current facilites in Burlington, Mass.
FileNet also said it will begin cutting an unspecified number of jobs and reduce hiring during the second quarter in an effort to "adjust its expense levels."
The company said it will post restructuring charges related to these changes in the second quarter of 1997, but the extent of the charge cannot be determined until a restructuring plan is completed.
Prudential Securities said Wednesday it downgraded FileNet to hold from buy.
